thread.title: No. 22 Michigan smothers Maryland 28-0 in Big Ten opener
thread.title_full: No. 22 Michigan smothers Maryland 28-0 in Big Ten opener

title: No. 22 Michigan smothers Maryland 28-0 in Big Ten opener
text:
No. 22 Michigan smothers Maryland 28-0 in Big Ten opener No. 22 Michigan routed Maryland 28-0 on Saturday. Post to Facebook No. 22 Michigan smothers Maryland 28-0 in Big Ten opener No. 22 Michigan routed Maryland 28-0 on Saturday.  //on.wusa9.com/1LaG6eg   Join the Conversation To   No. 22 Michigan smothers Maryland 28-0 in Big Ten opener Associated Press, AP 6:42 p.m. EDT October 3, 2015 Oct 3, 2015; College Park, MD, USA; Maryland Terrapins head coach Randy Edsall reacts on the sidelines during the Michigan Wolverines game at Byrd Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mitch Stringer-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Mitch Stringer, Mitch Stringer-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
COLLEGE PARK, Md. (AP) - Desmond Morgan had nine tackles and an interception, part of a dominating defensive performance by No. 22 Michigan in a 28-0 rout of Maryland on Saturday. 
In winning its first Big Ten opener under Jim Harbaugh, Michigan (4-1, 1-0) picked off three passes and limited Maryland to 105 yards. It was the second straight shutout for the Wolverines, who have allowed a total of 14 points in their last four games. 
Morgan, a senior inside linebacker, picked off a pass in the first quarter and was a major reason why the Terrapins (2-3, 0-1) finished with 29 yards rushing after averaging 196 over their first four games. 
Michigan led by only 6-0 at halftime before pulling away with two third-quarter touchdowns. After Jake Rudock connected with Drake Johnson for a 31-yard score, wide receiver Jehu Chesson took an inside handoff and sprinted down the left sideline for a 66-yard TD. 
That made it 21-0, a deficit way too formidable for Maryland to overcome. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE
